intro: Gnaphalium banksii, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are silvery-gray, covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium banksii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms.
